content.body:
The BigInt Math incubator call (https://github.com/tc39/Reflector/issues/433) is happening in two hours. 

I've just added an agenda (https://github.com/tc39/incubator-agendas/blob/main/2022/05-06.md) and am almost done with the slides (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1og0dwgl_0kQiOubsdwgI1X0ug0A7EEZYIJ2qv2ZDqVw/edit#slide=id.g1281fa65b8c_1_67). Hope to see as many people as possible there. : )

content.body: why are you doing `Math.abs` on timestamps? are there no monotonic timestamps available?

content.body: both `performance.now()` and `Date.now()` are monotonic afaik
happily, `Temporal.Duration` would be good for that use case, and it has an `abs()` method

content.body:
> <@shuyuguo:matrix.org> why are you doing `Math.abs` on timestamps? are there no monotonic timestamps available?

It’s been a while since I touched that code, but I believe that I was actually comparing high-resolution time *intervals* to intervals, rather than time instants to instants per se; intervals may be greater or less than each other. The code in the slides was an oversimplification.

content.body: Afterward, I was formatting the interval differences for display as a fixed-width plain-text table in a CLI’s console output, with the decimal places aligned. I needed to check for the presence of a minus sign in order to make the minus sign not contribute to the table columns’ text alignment.
* I was then formatting them for display as a fixed-width plain-text table in a CLI’s console output.

content.body: There was some other BigInt statistical analysis I was doing on those intervals—quartiles, deviations, that sort of thing—which I also was formatting for display in the CLI output’s digit-aligned plain-text table.

content.body: Yes. I myself am trying to compress all Unicode character names into a succinct data structure (for Fun), so I have needed bit lengths (and I *need* bit rank and select).
content.formatted_body: Yes. I myself am trying to compress all Unicode character names into a succinct data structure (for Fun), so I have needed bit lengths (and I need bit rank and select).

content.body: But those will come later. Well, the Unicode code space fits in Number safe integers anyway, so I guess rank and select aren’t blocked on BigInt Math…
* Yes. I myself am trying to compress all Unicode character names into a succinct lookup data structure (for Fun), so I have needed bit lengths (and I *need* bit rank and select).

content.body: …Anyways, Shu, I will remove BigInt clz32 and cbrt from this proposal, since WH isn’t blocking on those.

* But those will come later. Well, the Unicode code space fits in Number safe integers anyway, so I guess my Unicode name needs don’t need BigInts, so I need Numbers rank/select, not BigInt rank/select…
